pageContext.claim: “As you know, I stopped hundreds of millions of dollars from going to Guatemala, Honduras, and El Salvador because they haven't been doing what they should be doing.”
pageContext.analysis: In the past three years, both El Salvador’s homicide rate and migration flows have declined sharply, and officials from that country and the United States have said it was attributable in part to the U.S. aid Trump decided to cut. More than 72,000 Salvadorans were apprehended crossing the U.S. border in 2016. By 2018, the number had plummeted by more than half, to fewer than 32,000.
